name: Actinocephalus brevifolius
typeLocations: holotype RB RB1405306;isotype B;isotype CEN;isotype NY;isotype P;isotype SPF
locality: Alto Paraíso de Goiás, Parque Nacional da Chapada dos Veadeiros, Beira da estrada de terra para a Vereda do Mulungu
remarks: doi:10.5852/ejt.2022.834.1899 Etymology: 'The epithet 'brevifolius' is related to the species’ small leaf size both when compared to the morphologically similar species and also in relation to the size of its paraclades'.

name: Paepalanthus avacanoeiro
locality: Alto Paraíso de Goiás. [Morro dentro da propriedade da Aldeia Multiétnica, em campo pedregoso quartzítico recentemente queimado]
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.636.2.3 Etymology: the specific epithet pays tribute to one of the indigenous groups that once lived in the cerrados of central Brazil. Like many of Brazil's original peoples, the Avacanoeiros suffered violent massacres and were forcibly expelled from their ancestral lands. Today, only two families of Avacanoeiros remain, residing in Goias and Tocantins.

name: Paepalanthus burle-marxii
distribution: Brasília Distrito Federal (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Parque Nacional de Brasília, entrada pela portaria 6 em campo limpo, pedregoso, c. 1250 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.636.2.3 Etymology: the specific epithet celebrates Roberto Burle Marx, a brilliant Brazilian landscape architect and visual artist, whose designs include famous parks and gardens in Brasilia.

name: Paepalanthus ferrugineus
typeLocations: holotype OUPR 29438;isotype B;isotype HUFU;isotype NY;isotype P;isotype RB;isotype SPF
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Rio Pardo de Minas, Parque Estadual da Serra Nova. Alto da serra, passando pela estrada até Gerais Santana, 1257 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.505.2.5 The epithet ferrugineus, Latin for rusty, refers to the distinctive rust-coloured involucral bracts.

name: Paepalanthus irwinii
typeLocations: holotype RB RB1405241;isotype OUPR;isotype CEN CEN112954
locality: Alto Paraíso de Goiás, Parque Nacional da Chapada dos Veadeiros, GO 239, entre Alto Paraíso de Goiás e São Jorge
remarks: doi:10.5852/ejt.2022.834.1899 Etymology: 'The epithet 'irwinii' honors Howard Samuel Irwin, the coordinator of the Planalto Expeditions Program'.

name: Paepalanthus mellosilvae
typeLocations: holotype RB 600436;isotype BHCB;isotype K;isotype NY;isotype SP;isotype SPF 135081;isotype HUEFS 83902
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: São Tomé das Letras, Pico do Gavião, contrafortes sudoeste. Mata Nebular, 1400m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.500.3.9 The epithet is a tribute to Prof. Dr. Renato de Mello-Silva, who collected a very complete set of specimens of this new species, which was selected as the type collection.

name: Paepalanthus oreodoxus
typeLocations: holotype SPF;isotype BHCB;isotype DIAM;isotype MBML;isotype RB
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Conselheiro Pena, Serra do Padre Ângelo, Pico do Padre Ângelo, platô do topo do pico, 1480 m

name: Paepalanthus paganuccii
distribution: Bahia (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Maranhão (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Tocantins (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);
locality: Bahia: Município de Pilão Arcado, Barra do Iuiu, 436 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.560.2.1 Etymology: name honours Prof. Dr. Luciano Paganucci de Queiroz from the Universidade Estadual de Feira de Santana, Bahia, Brazil, for collecting the holotype and specially for his relevant contributions to the botanical studies of the Brazilian Semiarid region.

name: Paepalanthus sinuosus
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Capitólio, região da represa de Furnas, cachoeira abaixo da trilha da Pedreira Souza
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061189521 The specific epithet refers to the slender and sinuous stem.

name: Syngonanthus acephalus
reference: Ann. Missouri Bot. Gard. 78: 434, figs. 3H, I, 6. 1991

name: Syngonanthus culcitosus
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Capitólio, região da represa de Furnas, Chapadão da Babilônia, Serra do Turvo, próximo as pedreiras, nos flancos do Rio da Capivara, em cachoeira que corta a estrada, no caminho para a Cachoeira da Pedreira, 1019 m
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061189521 The specific epithet refers to the branched stems and colonies of individuals, forming fluffy pillows or mats.

name: Syngonanthus polyaxis
typeLocations: holotype OUPR;isotype B;isotype HUFU;isotype NY;isotype P;isotype RB;isotype SPF
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Rio Pardo de Minas, Parque Estadual da Serra Nova. Alto da serra, passando pela estrada até Gerais Santana, 983 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.505.2.5 The epithet polyaxis comes from the Greek, meaning 'many axes', in reference to the different parts composing the synflorescence, a unique characteristic within the genus.
